greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of iterated absolute differences of lucky numbers read by antidiagonals upwards.
comment: This sequence is related to the lucky numbers (cf. A000959) in the same way as A036262 is related to the prime numbers;
for n > 0: T(n,k) = abs(T(n,k+1) - T(n-1,k), k = 0 .. n-1.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 0..125 of triangle, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Lucky number.
program: iterate (\lds -> map abs $ zipWith (-) (tail lds) lds) a000959_list
where diags uss (vs:vss) = (map head wss) : diags (map tail wss) vss
xref: Cf. A054978 (left edge), A254969 (central terms), A000959 (right edge), A031883, A036262.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 11 2015
